title: Predictions For 2014
summary:
Key ideas
- The author makes global predictions, online community predictions, and personal predictions.
- The predictions cover areas such as politics, economics, technology, and personal life.
- The author rates the likelihood of each prediction coming true as a percentage.
- Many of the predictions have a high likelihood of not coming true.

Key learnings
- Making predictions can be helpful for assessing our beliefs and gaining a better understanding of the future.
- It is also important to acknowledge the uncertainty inherent in predictions.
- Assigning probabilities to predictions can help us understand the level of confidence we have in our beliefs.

Key questions
- What factors did the author consider when making these predictions?
- What can we learn from the author's predictions that did not come true?
- How can we use predictions as a tool for improving our decision-making and planning for the future?
